results.title: Australian business number : the key to your business
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Australian Business Number (ABN) introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes information on who should register and how to register for an ABN. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Australian business achievers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Training Media Services, DECO Corporation, Ivor J. Davies and Shaun Brown
results.brief_description: Profiles five high achieving Australian business people and their philosophies for success. Those profiled include; Rob Cartwright, Keith Williams, Jodee Rich, Guido Belgiorno and Sam Gance.

results.title: Australian bushrangers: Yrs 7-10. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Looks in detail at two eras of Australian bushranging. Uses extracts from feature films which recreate the incidents in the era 1790-1880 to focus on the question “Why have we glamorised bushrangers?” Part 1. “The Convict bolters” Bushranging in Australia started in the convict era. Convicts who broke out were known as bolters. The program focuses on the reasons the convicts bolted and gives information about some of the bolters. Part 2. “The Wild colonial boys” With the end of transportation bushranging moved into a new era. Bushrangers became associated with daring, bravado, defiance of authority and chivalry. Gives names and details of several of the “new” bushrangers. Overall the bushrangers are shown as thieves and murderers who inflict terror and destruction on the public. Companion volume to “Australian bushrangers. Part 3”

results.title: Australian bushrangers: Years 7-10. Pt. 3
results.brief_description: Uses extracts from early Australian feature films which recreate the incidents in the era 1790-1880 to focus on the question “Why do we choose an outlaw who was a robber and murderer as our national hero?” Gives details of the life of the Kelly Gang and their dealings with the law.

results.title: Australian bushrangers: Years 4-6
results.brief_description: This program is in three sections. 1. “Convict bolters”, 2. “Wild colonial boys”, 3. “The Kelly gang” and focuses on the question “Why have we glamorised bushrangers? Uses extracts from early Australian feature films which recreate the incidents of the era 1790-1880. The bushrangers are shown as outlaws who inflicted terror and destruction on the public. This program is an edited version of “Australian bushrangers. Yrs. 7-10”

results.title: Australian army at war 1939-1945 (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Frank Bagnall
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “War Experience”.
Uses actual newsreel footage to record the Australian soldier’s participation in the Second World War. Covers fighting in Libya, Greece, Crete, Syria and Tripoli, and the Singapore, New Guinea and Borneo campaigns.

results.title: Australian Army at war
results.brief_description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian animals dreaming stories (A)
results.brief_description: Aborigines used stories to teach their children about the laws and myths of their land. Pauline McLeod tells five stories about unique Australian animals. Each story is laced with colourful drawings. The stories featured are: ‘The Giant goanna and the black snake’; ‘The Platypus’; ‘How the kangaroo got its pouch’; ‘Why does the kookaburra laugh?’; ‘The Bunyip’.
